AboutMe.CardAboutDesc:
Front-end Developer aspiring to become Fullstack. Driven by curiosity and the desire to turn ideas into reality. I love building projects and exploring new technologies.



Outside of coding, I'm a fan of a good chess match, binge-watching series, and playing strategy and management games. I enjoy challenges that require reasoning and planning, both on screen and in real life.

CardSoftskillsDesc.Desc1: My interpersonal skills, developed by helping other devs and collaborating with fellow developers on the site Frontend Mentor.
CardSoftskillsDesc.Desc2: These skills are pillars of my growth, both inside and outside of coding.

AboutMe.CardAcademicDesc:
I'm self-taught and have been building my technical foundation through courses, learning paths, and a degree in IT Management.



I learn both through practice and in formal environments, always striving to grow as a developer.

KnowledgeLevel.Learning: I've had contact and studied, but haven't applied in a real project yet
KnowledgeLevel.Beginner: Used in a point project, with support or without complete mastery
KnowledgeLevel.Intermediate: Applied in more than one project and understand the flow
KnowledgeLevel.Advanced: Used frequently and solve problems autonomously
KnowledgeLevel.Familiar: Used in my own projects and have sufficient mastery to teach

html.Desc: Hypertext Markup Language used to create web pages. Responsible for defining the structural content of a web page, such as text, images, forms, etc.

css.Desc: Cascading Style Sheets used to style HTML elements and define the presentation of HTML or XML documents.

javascript.Desc: High-level programming language mainly used to create dynamic and interactive user interfaces in websites and applications.

typescript.Desc: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing and advanced development features such as interfaces, generics, and compile-time error checking.

csharp.Desc: C# is a modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft, widely used for desktop, web, mobile applications, and game development with Unity.

python.Desc: High-level programming language known for its simple syntax and readability. Used in various fields such as web development, data science, automation, and artificial intelligence.

jquery.Desc: JavaScript library that simplifies DOM manipulation, events, animations, and AJAX requests. Very popular before the rise of modern frameworks.

sass.Desc: Sass (Syntactically Awesome Stylesheets) is a CSS preprocessor that adds features such as variables, mixins, functions, and nesting, making it easier to write more organized and reusable styles.

less.Desc: CSS preprocessor that adds features such as variables, mixins, and functions, making the code more organized and reusable.

tailwind.Desc: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first framework for styling that allows applying styles directly to HTML elements using predefined classes, promoting speed and consistency in design.

styled-components.Desc: Library for styling React components using CSS within JavaScript. Enables creating encapsulated and dynamic styles with ease.

react.Desc: React is a JavaScript library for building reactive and component-based user interfaces. It uses the concept of Virtual DOM to optimize interface updates.

vue.Desc: Vue.js is a progressive framework for building user interfaces. Focused on the view layer, it allows creating reactive applications with simple and flexible syntax.

angular.Desc: JavaScript framework maintained by Google for building dynamic and scalable web applications. It uses a component-based architecture and offers integrated tools such as routing and dependency injection.

svelte.Desc: JavaScript framework that compiles components into highly optimized code at build time. Eliminates the need for a virtual DOM and provides excellent performance.

solid.Desc: Reactive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. Focuses on performance and simplicity, using compiled reactivity for efficient updates.

next.Desc: Next.js is a React-based framework that offers hybrid rendering (SSR, SSG), automatic routing, performance optimization, and native support for API routes, making it ideal for modern web applications.

nuxt.Desc: Nuxt.js is a Vue-based framework that simplifies the development of universal applications, with support for SSR, static generation, automatic routing, and a modular structure.

express.Desc: Express is a minimalist framework for Node.js that simplifies the creation of APIs and web applications. Provides a lightweight and flexible structure for handling routes, middleware, and HTTP requests.

nest.Desc: NestJS is a framework for Node.js that uses TypeScript and concepts of modular and object-oriented architecture. Ideal for building scalable and well-structured applications.

asp-net.Desc: ASP.NET is a Microsoft framework for building robust and scalable web applications. Supports multiple paradigms such as MVC, Web API, and Razor Pages, integrating with the .NET ecosystem.

postgresql.Desc: PostgreSQL is an open-source relational database management system known for its robustness, SQL standards compliance, and support for advanced extensions such as JSON and custom functions.

mongodb.Desc: MongoDB is a document-oriented NoSQL database that stores data in BSON format (similar to JSON), offering flexibility and scalability for modern applications.

prisma.Desc: Prisma is a modern ORM for Node.js and TypeScript that simplifies database access with static typing, automatic query generation, and integration with multiple relational databases.

dotnet.Desc: .NET is a Microsoft development platform that supports multiple languages, including C#, and enables the creation of web, desktop, mobile, and cloud applications with high performance.

node.Desc: Node.js is a server-side JavaScript runtime environment. Enables building fast and scalable applications using an event-driven, non-blocking architecture.

react-native.Desc: React Native is a framework created by Facebook for developing native mobile applications using JavaScript and React. Allows sharing logic across iOS and Android platforms.

expo.Desc: Expo is a platform and set of tools that simplifies development with React Native, offering automated builds, access to native APIs, and instant preview on devices.

nativewind.Desc: NativeWind is a library that brings the utility-first approach of Tailwind CSS to React Native, enabling fast and consistent styling with classes directly in components.

git.Desc: Git is a widely used distributed version control system for managing source code. Allows tracking changes, team collaboration, and maintaining development history.

figma.Desc: Figma is a cloud-based collaborative design tool used to create interfaces, prototypes, and user flows. Enables simultaneous work between designers and developers.

flask.Desc: Minimalist web framework written in Python. Ideal for simple and fast applications, offering flexibility and full control over project structure.

blazor.Desc: Blazor is a Microsoft framework that enables building interactive web applications using C# instead of JavaScript. Works both in the browser (via WebAssembly) and on the server.

zustand.Desc: Zustand is a lightweight state management library for React applications. Provides a simple and straightforward API with support for reactive updates and data persistence.

pinia.Desc: Pinia is a modern state management library for Vue.js applications. Lightweight, intuitive, and inspired by Vue 3â€™s composition pattern.

vite.Desc: Vite is an extremely fast frontend build and development tool. Uses ES modules and provides efficient hot module replacement for an agile development experience.

socket-io.Desc: JavaScript library that enables real-time bidirectional communication between client and server. Widely used in chats, online games, and collaborative applications.

turborepo.Desc: Modern tool for managing monorepos. Optimizes build and caching processes in projects with multiple packages, facilitating collaboration and scalability.

supabase.Desc: Backend-as-a-service platform that simplifies API creation, authentication, and SQL data storage. Provides a complete solution for developing web and mobile applications, with support for authentication and data storage.

firebase.Desc: Backend-as-a-service platform that simplifies API creation, authentication, and NoSQL data storage. Offers a complete solution for developing web and mobile applications.
